intro: Sisymbrium tarapacanum, commonly known as the Tarapacá tansy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
